result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolaus A. Egger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts with $25.00 due September 20, 2022 and the balance at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning October 20, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolaus A. Egger

defendant.name: Egger, Nickolaus A.
defendant.address: 102 E. Old Town Road, Westby, WI 54667

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

11:32 AM Defendant Nickolaus A. Egger in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Nickolaus A. Egger.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement recited into the record.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend to possession of THC as a misdemeanor - 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea colloquy.  Plea of no contest.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge. Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  3 days of sentence credit.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 today and $50.00 a month thereafter beginning October 20, 2022.
Initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nickolaus Egger appeared in person in custody.  Probable cause was previously found.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Statement by defendant. Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Defendant was advised of right to an attorney and notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
